definition: lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
boots
to scratch/old variant of 騷|骚[sao1]
to itch/to tickle

sentences.english: Capturing text of interest just scratches the surface.
sentences.chinese: 捕獲感興趣的文本僅僅是隔靴搔癢。

sentences.english: But this is the rub of course, because conspiracy theories are self-sealing.
sentences.chinese: 但這只是隔靴搔癢而已，因爲陰謀論都是自動生成的。

sentences.english: But if a pandemic does occur, this would be small comfort indeed.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果流行病真的發生了，這將只是隔靴搔癢。

definition: lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
conclusion/judgment/verdict

hard to tell if it's real or sham
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
sequel/continuation of a book
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it

word order
at one's ease/carefree
druggist
difficulty/degree of difficulty or ease
